moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 Nc6 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. Nf3 Bxc: This move offers White the best chances for an advantage.
moves.7... Nc5 8. d4 Na4: ?! Moving the N here leaves it in a corner.
moves.9. d5: Lots of choices, Ba3 was also possible and perhaps better, since Ne7 would have been necessary in response.
moves.14... h6: ? Better was a move like Ng6
moves.15. a4: This is part of long term plan to restrict Black
moves.15... Ng6 16. exd6 cxd6 17. Bb2: White begins to weaken Black's K side further.
moves.17... f6 18. h3 Bf5 19. Nd4 Bd7: White has now gained an additional tempo and has a well placed N.
moves.21. Rxa4: Of course, since White gets another N back.
moves.21... Bxa4 22. Bxg6: Now White has 2 bishops for R+P, and Black's K side is full of holes.
moves.23. Kh2 a5: ? Trying to get the passed pawn moving, but Bd2 was necessary since Ne6 is deadly.
moves.24. Ne6 Qb4: Wants to trade Qs even at expense of exchange.
moves.25. Qd4: White doesn't want the exchange, he wants checkmate.
moves.25... Bxc2: ? Desperate but Black is lost anyway.
moves.26. Bxc2 Rfe8: Black wants to get rid of the N.
moves.27. Nxg7: ! Again, White does not need the rook fork, White wants mate.
moves.27... Ref8: The N was immune, if KxN, Qf6+ and mate follows.
moves.28... Rf7 29. Rxf6 Qe1: Hoping for some kind of check, but..
moves.30. Rg6+: And Black resigns, if Kh7, Rg7+ and mate follows
